attires.name: Sarong
attires.description: A large tube or length of fabric, often wrapped around the waist. The way it is worn and the patterns used can signify marital status, region, and social standing.

attires.name: Ikat
attires.description: A resist-dyed woven fabric, often worn as a sash or skirt. The intricate patterns are a form of storytelling and cultural expression.

attires.name: Stagen
attires.description: A long, tightly wound sash worn around the waist, especially with a kebaya, to create a slender silhouette.
